Zack Mayo.Action: Responds to Byron Mayo's tentative greeting with polite affirmation and accepts companionship.
Shows nervousness and excitement passing bar girls, indicating vulnerability and openness.
Refuses to accept Byron's offer to stay in a whorehouse environment, insists on not going back to previous school, indicating self-respect and decisiveness.
Walks out when Byron says he doesn't want him, ignores Byron's call to come back.
Nervously but attentively takes in the bar scene, showing awareness of his environment.
Refuses to accept his father's suggestion to return to state school and boldly decides to find his own way instead of submitting to Byron’s lifestyle or authority.
Walks out resolutely despite his father's call to come back, showing decisiveness and confidence.
Brightens and thanks Byron sincerely after winning the brief exchange.
Hides money Byron gives him rather than openly accepting it.
Laughs with Tiki, showing natural friendliness and ease.
Engages politely but cautiously with Filipino boys on the street.
Accepts money from Byron and cleverly hides it in his shoe, indicating awareness and caution.
Observes the jet pilots' dangerous game thoughtfully, indicating curiosity and situational awareness.
Keeps moving away from Byron when called, showing some independence but possibly a lack of immediate responsiveness.
Laughs and trusts two local boys who offer to show him around.
Does not retaliate aggressively or escalate the situation after being attacked and robbed.
Laughs and trusts two strangers who immediately rob and beat him, demonstrating poor judgment and lack of situational awareness.
Fights back despite being outmatched but ultimately loses and is seriously injured, indicating limited fighting skill against more experienced opponents.
Greets Byron warmly despite their rough past, shares personal achievement (graduation) in friendly manner.
Shouts 'Shore Patrol!' authoritatively to gain entry without hesitation, showing bluntness rather than friendliness.
Shows some emotional reserve or avoids inviting Byron to graduation (implied by expression shedding doubt when Byron says he should have been invited).
Knocks authoritatively and shouts 'Shore Patrol! Shore Patrol! Open up!!' demonstrating confidence and command presence.
Graduates college despite earlier setbacks and talks his way into another college showing resourcefulness and persistence.
His expression sheds doubt about inviting Byron to his graduation, indicating possible social discomfort or omission.
Jokes with Byron and the prostitutes, laughing along with them.
Wakes up, observes the sordid scene with profound disgust and turns away.
Participates in a hedonistic, disorganized party involving drugs, alcohol, and promiscuity, showing lack of control or discipline.
Wakes up disoriented and hungover but notices the chaotic and unhealthy environment and reacts with disgust, indicating self-awareness and recognition of poor choices.
Hands Byron a towel when requested without hesitation.
Laughs lightly when Byron reacts skeptically to his Navy plans, showing ease and humor.
Does not argue or get defensive when Byron mocks his Navy aspirations, instead responding calmly.
Says goodbye respectfully and concisely, avoiding conflict.
Confidently announces joining the Navy and aiming to fly jets despite skepticism from Byron.
Remains quiet and thoughtful when Byron talks about past exploits, indicating reflection rather than impulsiveness.
Reddening slightly and laughing when Byron laughs at his Navy plans, showing a moment of self-consciousness but not backing down.
Turns, grins and thanks Byron for the graduation present, rejecting fatherly bullshit with friendly humor.
Walks out promptly after brief exchange without lingering or showing emotional connection.
Covers his eagle tattoo with a band-aid before entering the naval air station, showing awareness of rules or propriety.
Drives confidently through the gates of the naval air station without hesitation.
Engages in teasing but confident dialogue with Byron, showing social ease and self-confidence.
Complies without complaint to wait with other civilian types under a tree when directed by a Navy lieutenant.
Flirts confidently with Casey Seeger, showing social ease and self-assurance among peers.
Chuckles quietly at Foley's offensive remarks but does not escalate conflict; maintains a straight, unintimidated face when challenged.
Responds respectfully and sincerely with his full name under pressure.
Keeps composure and does not retaliate verbally against Foley's aggression and insults.
Keeps a straight face and remains totally unintimidated when berated aggressively by Foley.
Maintains eye contact and does not show fear or submission during a hostile confrontation.
Chuckles slightly inappropriately during a tense situation and is warned.
Opens his suitcase promptly and submits to inspection without complaint.
Does not react emotionally or lose composure under Foley's verbal provocation and inspection.
Takes the upper bunk by the window immediately upon entering the room without consulting roommates, asserting his priority by 'first come, first served.'
Grabs the upper bunk first upon entering the room and asserts his claim confidently when questioned.
Shares a knowing glance with Sid, but remains silent about his past at Subic when Sid expresses interest.
Makes a joking but somewhat harsh comment to Sid about 'scuzzy' girls and 'Puget Dudes.'
Responds to Casey with teasing humor and friendly banter.
Stows his locker expertly and confidently responds to Sid with insider knowledge about Subic.
Engages in banter with peers demonstrating social confidence and wit.
Obeys Foley's command immediately and performs push-ups without hesitation.

Eats fastest and smiles smugly passing Foley.

Smiles smugly as he passes Foley after quickly finishing eating.

Participates fully in the physically demanding cross-country course, pushing himself alongside peers.
Rebukes Topper for urinating in the sink, showing concern for cleanliness and respect for shared space.
Disgusted at Topper's behavior but patiently explains the truth to calm his fears.
Hardens his eyes with disgust upon seeing Topper urinate in the sink he just cleaned.
Accepts the tough reality of being exhausted and unconditioned compared to the advanced class, showing awareness of the gap in skill and conditioning.

Observes others preparing frantically for inspection but remains calm and confident.

Struggles to understand difficult material but persists in trying to learn.
Buys goods from an enlisted sailor and shows a big grin afterwards.
Struggles to comprehend advanced physics and appears unfamiliar with using a slide rule unlike his peers.

Smiles quietly when Paula doubts his story about his father and upbringing.

Engages in light, playful conversation with Paula, smiling and grinning but sharing little personal information.
Engages in smooth, confident conversation with Paula and exhibits relaxed, witty responses.
